comment.author: 32357722@N06
comment._content: This is the dock area in Oswego, NY.

comment.author: 23655958@N03
comment._content: Lumber carried by ships like this, from Canada or upper Great Lakes, Oswego was a transfer point for lumber from lake ships to canal barges. There was a steamer Pueblo 1891 to 1927 on the Great Lakes. images.maritimehistoryofthegreatlakes.ca/results.asp?fsu=... Ithaca's own Henry Williams Sage imported lumber from his mill north of Toronto, via Oswego to his wholesale lumber yard at Albany, in the 1850s. Does Cornell University Library's photostream have any photo's relating to HWS ?
